name: avariciously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving in a way that shows an extremely strong wish to get or keep money or possessions: Developers waited avariciously for the go-ahead to transform old stations into offices, shops, and fast-food restaurants. The accountant avariciously stuffed money into a bag. See
avarice
More examplesFewer examplesIt’s a music industry that avariciously consumes younger and younger talent.The play’s villain is properly menacing and avariciously psychopathic.During his four years with the team, trophies were accumulated avariciously.
